paragraphs.content: From India to Texas, my passion for robots has taken me on a journey of learning and building. With more than 2 years of experience under my belt, I'm a robotics software engineer who loves making things work, especially in the world of unmanned vehicles.

Sensors, Neural Networks and PyTorch - these are my tools, and perception and motion prediction are my playgrounds. I'm hands-on, from tinkering with Nvidia Jetson Xaviers for deep neural networks to fusing lidar, camera, and other sensor data for robot brains.
As president of UTA's AutonoBots club, I led the charge in robot SLAM and competed in the National Robotics Challenge. Teamwork and real-world challenges? Bring it on!

In my free time, I'm a maker, a gamer, and a musician in the making. I love to build things, whether it's a robot, a game, or a song. I'm also a big fan of the outdoors, and I'm always up for a hike or a camping trip.
My 'do it now' spirit keeps me pushing boundaries, always hungry for new tech and research. I'm eager to join a team where my skills and passion can fuel innovation in robotics, AI, and beyond.
Thanks for taking the time to learn about me and my work. Let's talk!
techie23 [dot] vin [at] gmail [dot] com
